definition: surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: It remains a historical mission for China to accelerate the process of urbanization, which will enable the nation to move towards moderate prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 大力推进城市化，是中国奔向小康社会的历史重任。

sentences.english: Only one of three women in the Berlusconi government had a heavyweight job.
sentences.chinese: 在贝卢斯科尼政府的三名女性，只有一名被赋予重任。

sentences.english: But we cannot let her carry this burden on her own.
sentences.chinese: 但我们不应让她一个人来承担这个重任。

sentences.english: Chat, carry birds existence to multiply greatly development progress of history heavy responsibility also.
sentences.chinese: 聊天乎，担负鸟类生存繁衍发展进步之历史重任者也。

sentences.english: Each of you was selected by your district to be here.
sentences.chinese: 我们百周年領导扶輪地区的重任。

sentences.english: Here are the young men then, a weight on their shoulders, but love in their hearts.
sentences.chinese: 就是这群年轻人，肩负重任，心怀梦想。

sentences.english: If China doesn't step up, it's hard to think who could.
sentences.chinese: 如果中国不愿拍马来救，很难想象谁还能担此重任。

sentences.english: Were primordial methanogens up to the task?
sentences.chinese: 原始的产甲烷菌足以担当这个重任吗？

sentences.english: This ancient fire wall can no longer take the full burden of fire-proofing.
sentences.chinese: 建筑的风火墙早已无法承担防火的重任了。

sentences.english: However there are other champions in this group that can do it too.
sentences.chinese: 然而，球队中的其他冠军球员也可以担此重任。

sentences.english: After Mr Abbas steps down, who will take over?
sentences.chinese: 现在阿巴斯即将离开，谁将接下重任？

sentences.english: He is a man who has his own judgement, and who can bear heavy responsibilities at critical time.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个有主见的人，一个在关键时刻堪当重任的人。

sentences.english: He's not yet up to the task of a great poem yet.
sentences.chinese: 他还不能担当写出伟大诗作的重任。

sentences.english: This is an important task which the people have entrusted to us.
sentences.chinese: 这是人民赋予我们的重任。

sentences.english: Will we be able to accept the responsibility of building the future of our country?
sentences.chinese: 我们能够承担建设祖国未来的重任吗？

sentences.english: He is taxed withthe job of collecting the latest military information.
sentences.chinese: 他被委以重任，搜集最新的军事情报。

definition: to shoulder (a burden)/to bear/to suffer (a disadvantage)
to be duty bound/to be one's unshirkable responsibility
carrying pole and the loads on it/burden/task/responsibility/CL:副[fu4]
mission/long-term task to which one devotes oneself/a calling
capital of Wei 魏 during Warring states/CL:根[gen1]
(idiom) to take on a leadership role at a time of crisis
